name: Rosetta Stone
description: A granodiorite stele inscribed with a decree in three scripts: Greek, Demotic, and Egyptian hieroglyphs. It was key to deciphering ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics.

name: Terracotta Army
description: A collection of terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China, buried with him to protect him in the afterlife.

name: Mona Lisa
description: A portrait painting by Leonardo da Vinci, renowned for its enigmatic smile and mastery of Renaissance techniques.

name: Dead Sea Scrolls
description: Ancient Jewish manuscripts discovered near the Dead Sea, including the oldest known biblical texts.

name: Tutankhamunâ€™s Mask
description: A gold funerary mask of the Egyptian Pharaoh Tutankhamun, signifying his royal status and divinity.

name: Antikythera Mechanism
description: An ancient Greek analog computer used to predict astronomical positions and eclipses for calendrical and astrological purposes.

name: Code of Hammurabi
description: A basalt stele inscribed with one of the earliest and most complete written legal codes from ancient Babylon.

name: Stonehenge
description: A prehistoric stone circle in England, its purpose remains a subject of research and speculation.

name: Venus of Willendorf
description: A small Paleolithic figurine of a woman, symbolizing fertility and possibly used as a talisman.

name: Bayeux Tapestry
description: An embroidered cloth depicting the events leading up to the Norman conquest of England in 1066.
